title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
descr: Use verbatim methods and equipment to capture, store, retrieve, and transcribe pretrial and trial proceedings or other information. Includes stenocaptioners who operate computerized stenographic captioning equipment to provide captions of live or prerecorded broadcasts for hearing-impaired viewers.
alt_titles: Certified Shorthand Reporter (CSR), Court Monitor, Court Recorder, Court Recording Monitor, Court Reporter, Court Stenographer, Court Transcriber, Deposition Reporter, Digital Court Reporter, Electronic Court Recorder, Hearings Reporter, Judicial Reporter, Official Court Reporter, Realtime Captioner, Realtime Court Reporter, Recorder, Shorthand Reporter, Stenocaptioner, Stenographer, Stenotype Operator, Text Transcriber, Transcript Clerk, Voice Writing Reporter
experience: Previous work-related skill, knowledge, or experience is required for these occupations. For example, an electrician must have completed three or four years of apprenticeship or several years of vocational training, and often must have passed a licensing exam, in order to perform the job.
education: Most occupations in this zone require training in vocational schools, related on-the-job experience, or an associate's degree.
job_training: Employees in these occupations usually need one or two years of training involving both on-the-job experience and informal training with experienced workers. A recognized apprenticeship program may be associated with these occupations.
example: These occupations usually involve using communication and organizational skills to coordinate, supervise, manage, or train others to accomplish goals. Examples include hydroelectric production managers, desktop publishers, electricians, agricultural technicians, barbers, court reporters and simultaneous captioners, and medical assistants.
svp_desc: Individuals workers typically need anywhere from between 1 and 2 years- up to 4 years- to learn the techniques, acquire the information, and develop the facility needed for average performance in specific situations.

work_tasks.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
work_tasks.task: Take notes in shorthand or use a stenotype or shorthand machine that prints letters on a paper tape.

work_tasks.task: Record verbatim proceedings of courts, legislative assemblies, committee meetings, and other proceedings, using computerized recording equipment, electronic stenograph machines, or stenomasks.

work_tasks.descr: Transcribe recorded proceedings in accordance with established formats.

work_tasks.task: Ask speakers to clarify inaudible statements.
work_tasks.descr: Ask speakers to clarify inaudible statements.

work_tasks.descr: File a legible transcript of records of a court case with the court clerk's office.

work_tasks.task: File and store shorthand notes of court session.
work_tasks.descr: File and store shorthand notes of court session.

work_tasks.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners

work_tasks.descr: Respond to requests during court sessions to read portions of the proceedings already recorded.

work_tasks.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
work_tasks.task: Record depositions and other proceedings for attorneys.
work_tasks.descr: Record depositions and other proceedings for attorneys.

work_tasks.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
work_tasks.task: Verify accuracy of transcripts by checking copies against original records of proceedings and accuracy of rulings by checking with judges.
work_tasks.descr: Verify accuracy of transcripts by checking copies against original records of proceedings and accuracy of rulings by checking with judges.

work_tasks.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
work_tasks.task: Record symbols on computer storage media and use computer aided transcription to translate and display them as text.
work_tasks.descr: Record symbols on computer storage media and use computer aided transcription to translate and display them as text.

work_tasks.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
work_tasks.task: Proofread transcripts for correct spelling of words.

work_tasks.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners

work_tasks.descr: Log and store exhibits from court proceedings.

work_behaviors.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners

work_behaviors.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners

work_behaviors.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
work_behaviors.descr: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

work_behaviors.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
work_behaviors.descr: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).

work_behaviors.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Study a technical manual while listening to loud construction sounds
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Answer a business call with coworkers talking nearby

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to shift back and forth between two or more activities or sources of information (such as speech, sounds, touch, or other sources).
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Monitor radar and radio transmissions to keep track of heavy aircraft traffic
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Listen to music while entering numbers into a spreadsheet

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to generate or use different sets of rules for combining or grouping things in different ways.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Classify man-made fibers in terms of their characteristics, like strength or cost
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Sort paintbrushes based on length

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Design an aircraft wing using principles of aerodynamics
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Know that a stalled car can coast downhill

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Identify as many strategies as possible for a company acquisition and merger
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Name four different uses for a screwdriver

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Diagnose a disease using results of many different lab tests
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Decide what to wear based on the weather report

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Assemble a wind turbine
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Put things in numerical order

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Invent a new type of man-made fiber
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Use a credit card to open a locked door

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Recognize an illness at an early stage of a disease when there are only a few symptoms
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Recognize that an unplugged lamp won't work

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to remember information such as words, numbers, pictures, and procedures.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Recite a 300-word speech after studying it for 15 minutes
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Remember the number on your bus to be sure you get back on the right one

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to identify or detect a known pattern (a figure, object, word, or sound) that is hidden in other distracting material.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Identify camouflaged animals from a moving vehicle while on a safari
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Detect that your phone is ringing while at a concert

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to quickly and accurately compare similarities and differences among sets of letters, numbers, objects, pictures, or patterns. The things to be compared may be presented at the same time or one after the other. This ability also includes comparing a presented object with a remembered object.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Inspect electrical parts for defects as they pass on a fast-moving assembly line
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Sort mail according to ZIP codes with no time pressure

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners

behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Interpret patterns on weather radar to decide if the weather is changing
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Recognize a song after hearing only the first few notes

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.
behaviors_abilities.max_anchor_descr: Determine the mathematics required to simulate a space craft landing on the moon
behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Determine how much 20 oranges will cost when they are priced at 5 for 4 dollars

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to add, subtract, multiply, or divide quickly and correctly.

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
behaviors_abilities.descr: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

behaviors_abilities.min_anchor_descr: Place an order at a restaurant drive-thru

behaviors_abilities.title: Court Reporters and Simultaneous Captioners
